subject: p17838301
Findings: Single AP upright portable view of the chest was obtained. The patients overlying chin obscures the medial bilateral upper lobes. The cardiac silhouette remains enlarged. Prominence of the pulmonary arteries is partially imaged and again seen. Evidence of diaphragmatic/pleural plaques is seen bilaterally suggesting prior asbestos exposure.
Impression: The patients chin overlies the bilateral medial upper lobes, obscuring the view. Given this, the cardiac silhouette is persistently enlarged. There is again prominence of the pulmonary arteries. Pulmonary vascular congestion appears improved.
